channel.title: Extract all classes that are loaded to JVM?
channel.description:
I've managed to extract classes from the current ClassLoader, but I need to extract all.
So for example if I have various java programs open I want to get all the classes from JVM.
Thanks.

item.title: Extract all classes that are loaded to JVM?
item.dc:creator: @Tha_Owner Tha Owner
item.description:
@Tha_Owner wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:4, topic:267707”]Tha Owner, you need to add the javaagent to the applet paramaters,

use this guide.[/quote]
Thank you. Checked that topic and seems to help me out. Will test later tho.

Read full topic

item.title: Extract all classes that are loaded to JVM?
item.dc:creator: @Tha_Owner Tha Owner
item.description:
@Tha_Owner wrote:

Hey, thanks for the hint. However I have some problems.

I’m doing this:

java -javaagent:agent.jar MyClassNameHere

Result is something like that:
16.03.2009 20:54:32 - java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableMap
16.03.2009 20:54:32 - sun.reflect.ByteVector
16.03.2009 20:54:32 - sun.font.CompositeFont
16.03.2009 20:54:32 - [Lsun.font.CompositeFont;
16.03.2009 20:54:32 - java.lang.ref.Finalizer
16.03.2009 20:54:32 - MyClassNameHere
… + loads of more classes

I am printing out the classnames after the MyClassNameHere application is closed. However I am unable to print out classes associated with other java applications. So for example I open runescape.com and also open MyClassNameHere, I don’t see RS.com classes in my logfile.

Read full topic
item.source: Extract all classes that are loaded to JVM?
